other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia with nonspecific T-wave changes.
Small right pleural effusion and right lower-lobe infiltrate.
Multiple subsegmental and segmental pulmonary emboli, evolving pulmonary infarct in the right lower lobe, and a small right pleural effusion.
3+ protein and 2+ blood, with 5 to 10 white cells and 4 to 10 nondysmorphic red cells per high-power field.
Membranous nephropathy, stage II to III, with thickened glomerular basement membrane and subepithelial deposits.
Diffuse irregularity and beading of the intrahepatic bile ducts, smooth tapering at the distal end of the extrahepatic bile duct.
Moderate inflammation throughout the colon including the rectum; biopsy revealed mild-to-moderate chronic active pancolitis.
